content:
Draft Revision No. 1 to Project Agreement No. 99-471-1029 Excess Equipment ; Project No. 484-99-47]
This amendment is issued to indicate the estimated allocations made to the various recipients:
Part A: Counterpart deposit of funds allocated to the following non-revenue producing agencies is waived:
(1) Public Works Bureau (PWB) US$28,000
Sub-total US$28,000
Part B: The funds allocated to the following agencies will be repaid in New Taiwan Dollars in accordance with the terms set forth below.
(2) Taiwan Highway Bureau (THB)
US$2,400
(3) Taiwan Power Company (TPC)
2,000
(4) Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau (KsHB)
2,000
(5) Keelung Harbor Bureau (KIHB)
6,000
(6) Shihmen Development Commission (SDC)
29,000
Sub-total
US$41,400
Total
US$69,400
Repayment Schedule :
Interest shall accrue at the rate of 5% per annum through # from the date of the receipt of the first shipment by the recipient. Such accrued interest shall be added to the principal and the sum thereof shall become a new principal. The new principal shall be liquidated in 18 quarterly installments commencing one year after receipt of equipment. Each quarterly payment of principal and in- terest shall be computed on annuity basis at the interest rate of 5% per annum and an amortization period of 18 quarterly installments. Except for those specified above, standard terms of repayment are applicable.
Disposal of the balance of US$130,600 will be included in a further amendment or amendments to this agreement.
# To be determined when the repayment starting date is definitely known.
Ì
adenial historiça
389

paragraphs.content: Draft Revision No. 1 to Project Agreement No. 99-471-1029 Excess Equipment ; Project No. 484-99-47]
This amendment is issued to indicate the estimated allocations made to the various recipients:
Part A: Counterpart deposit of funds allocated to the following non-revenue producing agencies is waived:
Part B: The funds allocated to the following agencies will be repaid in New Taiwan Dollars in accordance with the terms set forth below.

Interest shall accrue at the rate of 5% per annum through # from the date of the receipt of the first shipment by the recipient. Such accrued interest shall be added to the principal and the sum thereof shall become a new principal. The new principal shall be liquidated in 18 quarterly installments commencing one year after receipt of equipment. Each quarterly payment of principal and in- terest shall be computed on annuity basis at the interest rate of 5% per annum and an amortization period of 18 quarterly installments. Except for those specified above, standard terms of repayment are applicable.
Disposal of the balance of US$130,600 will be included in a further amendment or amendments to this agreement.
# To be determined when the repayment starting date is definitely known.
